projects: [{"title":"Mathematical Modeling of a Sequencing Batch Reactor (SBR) (Master’s Project)","start_date":"Aug 2020","end_date":"Aug 2021","description":"Modelling of SBR involving both the Aerobic (BOD Removal and Nitrification) and Anaerobic (Denitrification) processesFormulated and simulated a system of 10 simultaneous differential equations using optimized Runge Kutta Method170 cycles required to achieve complete substrate and ammonium degradation and appreciable nitrate degradation"},{"title":"Design Discharge Estimation : Hydraulic and Hydrologic Design","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Feb 2020","description":"Design discharge estimated for 50 year return period flood at 5 cities using 100 years of annual maximum daily discharge.Suitability of Exponential, Gaussian, Lognormal, Gamma, Pearson Type-III and Gumbel distributions tested by performing Chi-squared, Kolmogorov-Smirnov and Anderson-Darling tests respectively for each site data.Best distribution model for each site was selected by comparing Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) and Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) values for the models for which the null hypothesis was not rejected."},{"title":"Sparse Recovery: Introduction to Machine Learning (CS771A Course Project)","start_date":"Jan 2020","end_date":"Feb 2020","description":"Solving a L1 regularized, least squared (Least Absolute Shrinkage and SelecƟon Operator: LASSO) regression problemPerformed Primal Subgradient Descent and Primal Proximal Gradient Descent methods to learn sparse linear modelStep length hyperparameters and regularization parameters were tuned for best results for both the methodsBetter convergence results were reported for the Primal Proximal Gradient Descent method"},{"title":"Store Item Demand Forecasting Challenge : Data Mining (IME672A Course Project)","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"Jul 2019","description":"Predicted and analyzed 3 months of sales for 50 different items at 10 different stores given 5 years of store item sales data.Performed Exploratory Data Analysis with Prophet Modelling and MLP Neural Network Forecast Modelling and compared the final results with the conventional ARIMA Model (Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average Model) used for the time series data.Symmetric Mean Absolute Percent Error (SMAPE) achieved for Prophet Model was 20% which was lesser than the SMAPE for ARIMA Model (25%) due to better prediction of seasonality trends with the Prophet Model."},{"title":"Surveying and Mapping : Geoinformatics (CE331A Course Project)","start_date":"Aug 2018","end_date":"Nov 2018","description":"Surveyed the Academic Area of IIT Kanpur in global co-ordinate system (using GPS) and prepared a map using QGIS.Created a web based GIS mapping using JUNO and performed topographic mapping and road profiling."}]
